# The United Nations: 'collective security' .tiny[(by the Security Council)]

> .Large[UN Charter. Chapter 7, Article 41:]
.black[.large["[If other means are .hl2[inadequate],] ... complete or partial interruption of .hl1[economic relations] and of rail, sea, air, postal, telegraphic, radio, and other means of .hl1[communication], and the severance of diplomatic relations ... [can be used against a country]."]]

--

> .Large[UN Charter. Chapter 7, Article 42:]
.black[.large["[If .hl2[Article 41] is .hl2[inadequate],] ... demonstrations, blockade, and .hl1[other operations] by air, sea, or land forces ... [can be undertaken against a country]."]]

--

.Large[In other words: *We're all equal ('sovereignty') and we don't use force against each other, but when one country messes around, the .green[rest of us] will .pink[punish] despite the concerns over sovereignty and peace.*]

# UN organizations:

```{r, fig.width=14, fig.align='center'}

library(ggplot2)
library(dplyr)
library(grid)

# -------------------------
# 1) Node layout (re-spaced)
# -------------------------
nodes <- tibble::tribble(
  ~id,           ~label,                               ~x,  ~y,   ~w,  ~h,
  "un",          "United Nations (UN)",                 0,  12,  5.2, 0.9,
  
  # Six principal organs (spread horizontally)
  "ga",          "General\nAssembly (GA)",              -6,  10,  3.8, 0.9,
  "sc",          "Security Council\n(SC)",              -2,  10,  3.8, 0.9,
  "ecosoc",      "ECOSOC",                              2,  10,  3.8, 0.9,
  "icj",         "ICJ",                                 6,  10,  3.8, 0.9,
  
  "secretariat", "Secretariat",                         0,   8.3, 3.6, 0.9,
  "trusteeship", "Trusteeship\nCouncil (inactive)",      0,   7.0, 4.2, 0.9,
  
  # UN system layer (lower)
  "funds",       "Funds & Programmes\n(UNICEF, UNDP, WFP)", -5,  5.2, 5.2, 1.1,
  "agencies",    "Specialized Agencies\n(WHO, ILO, FAO)",    5,  5.2, 5.2, 1.1
)

nodes <- nodes %>%
  mutate(
    xmin = x - w/2, xmax = x + w/2,
    ymin = y - h/2, ymax = y + h/2
  )

# -------------------------
# 2) Edges
# -------------------------
edges <- tibble::tribble(
  ~from, ~to,
  "un", "ga",
  "un", "sc",
  "un", "ecosoc",
  "un", "icj",
  "un", "secretariat",
  "un", "trusteeship",
  "ga", "funds",
  "ecosoc", "agencies"
) %>%
  left_join(nodes %>% select(id, x, ymin), by = c("from" = "id")) %>%
  rename(x_start = x, y_start = ymin) %>%
  left_join(nodes %>% select(id, x, ymax), by = c("to" = "id")) %>%
  rename(x_end = x, y_end = ymax)

# -------------------------
# 3) Plot
# -------------------------
ggplot() +
  geom_segment(
    data = edges,
    aes(x = x_start, y = y_start, xend = x_end, yend = y_end),
    arrow = arrow(length = unit(10, "pt"), type = "closed"),
    linewidth = 0.6
  ) +
  geom_rect(
    data = nodes,
    aes(xmin = xmin, xmax = xmax, ymin = ymin, ymax = ymax),
    linewidth = 0.7,
    fill='blue'
  ) +
  geom_text(
    data = nodes,
    aes(x = x, y = y, label = label),
    size = 8,
    lineheight = 0.95,
    color='white'
    
  ) +
  coord_cartesian(xlim = c(-9, 9), ylim = c(4, 13), expand = FALSE) +
  theme_void() 

```
